Wildfire Geospatial Intelligence Unit, Wildfire Operations, Wildfire Management Branch, Forestry Division

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Wildfires from 1931 to the end of the 2018 Fire Year (December31, 2018) within the forested area of the province have been recorded and mapped in a variety of different ways. Fire perimeters have been captured using hand sketches, aerial photography, satellite imagery, global positioning systems and infrared scanning methods and have been archived in various forms. These include the transfer of line work to paper or films of forest inventory maps, provincial base maps or more recently captured in digital form. All these historical fires that have a polygon line representing the fire perimeter have recently had the line work entered into a Geographic Information System. This data set does not represent every fire from the fire years. Rather, it represents some of the larger fires that were capable of capturing.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Recording the fire perimeters accurately on maps within the forested area of the province is essential for fire incidence analysis, timber loss, timber salvage, maintenance of the provincial forest inventory, timber stand origins and for assisting in the making of sound forest management decisions.

idPoC.rpOrgName: Environment and Sustainable Resource Development, Government of Alberta
idPoC.rpPosName: Wildfire Aviation and Geomatics Unit, Wildfire Operations Section, Wildfire Management Branch, Forestry and Emergency Response Division

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: The compiling and storage of the individual fire maps have evolved from hard copy storage of the various fire maps on stick plans to hand drafting all fires greater than 200 hectares on 1:250 000 planimetric base maps to having all mapped fires digitized and entered into a Geographic Information System at various accuracy levels depending upon original data available.
dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.5.0.6491

prcStep.stepDesc: Updated Photo Interpreted Boundaries for: MWF-009-2016; HWF-158-2016; HWF-159-2016; LWF-071-2016; LWF-076-2016; LWF-097-2016; LWF-103-2016

dataLineage.statement: Added 2018 Fire Year data - March 1, 2019 Updated Photo Interpreted Boundaries for: HWF-196-2017; HWF-221-2017; HWF-242-2017; HWF-246-2017; PWF-068-2017; RWF-062-2017; RWF-063-2017; RWF-065-2017; RWF-068-2017; RWF-078-2017

prcStep.stepDesc: Added fire perimeter for GWF-165-2008 submitted June 4, 2009
Added the fires from the 2009 Fire Year with the simple data loader.
Re-added the 2009 fires as 11 fires/features were submitted after the last compilation.

Added one 1987 fire, one 1997 fire, and twelve 2009 fires that were all discovered to exist in Area offices but missing from this dataset. The fire numbers for these are as follows: DB1-001-1987 S01-019-1997 LCU-006-2009 LCU-009-2009 LWF-177-2009 MWF-009-2009 MWF-022-2009 MWF-035-2009 MWF-046-2009 MWF-048-2009 MWF-057-2009 MWF-066-2009 WWF-101-2009 WWF-102-2009
Added the 2010 fires using the Simple Data Loader
Added the 2011 Fire Year wildfire perimeters using the simple data loader.

Added the 2012 fire data. Removed the 1950 Chinchaga Fire and replaced it with a smaller version said to be more true. Also added WWF-005-2010, WTO-001-2010, LWF-215-2011, and PWF-013-2011. Added ALIAS values for P01-009-2000, P01-021-2000, RWF-085-2001, and CWF-144-2003. Deleted CWF-016-2010, as it was already captured as CWF-258-2009. And finally, sorted the features based on YEAR (ASC) and FIRENUMBER (ASC).
Replaced HWF-107-2012 and HWF-211-2012 with new versions that show more growth since the previous data capture. Also, added the 2013 Fire Year fire perimeters.
Added the 2014 fire perimeter data with the Simple Data Loader.

Replaced the ArcSDE feature class that was in the Geographic Coordinate System with a new feature class projected in the Alberta 10TM projection (NAD_1983_10TM_AEP_Forest, WKID: 3400 Authority: EPSG).
prcStep.stepRat: We wish to have geometry units in real world units rather than in decimal degrees for area and length fields, and the data is most commonly displayed in Alberta 10TM.

prcStep.stepDesc: Removed GPS'ed version of GWF-046-2013. Added the following fires with the Simple Data Loader: DB2-018-1991 CCI-002-2013 GWF-046-2013 (aerial stereo image interpretation version) Added ALIAS (fire name) field values to the following fires: REF-020-1934 REF-021-1934 REF-025-1936 REF-026-1936 REF-028-1936 REF-987-1954 CWF-092-2003 CCU-002-2012 CCU-003-2012

Added the following fire data: - CCU-001-2011 (no previous data existed) - CCU-002-2012 (satellite classified replaces previously existing GPS data) - CCU-003-2012 (satellite classified replaces previously existing GPS data) - RWF-034-2014 (air photo interpretation replaces previously existing GPS data) - GWF-043-2014 (air photo interpretation replaces previously existing hand-sketch data) - EWF-052-2014 (air photo interpretation replaces previously existing GPS data) - EWF-054-2014 (air photo interpretation replaces previously existing GPS data) - CCU-003-2015 (no previous data existed) - RWF-135-2015 (no previous data existed) - CWF-209-2015 (no previous data existed) - CWF-231-2015 (no previous data existed)

prcStep.stepDesc: Integrated the linework from overlapping fire perimeters from within the 2015 fire year so that no 2015 polygon overlaps another 2015 polygon. Added some satellite classified fire perimeter data for portions of three fires that extended beyond the Alberta border: ASK-001-2015 in Saskatchewan LWF-175-2015 in Saskatchewan PBZ-002-2015 in British Columbia Also, updated the CAPTURE_DATE and TIME values for the Alberta portions of ASK-001-2015 and PBZ-002-2015 to properly reflect the scene date of that imagery used for the burn classification.

stepProc.rpIndName: Wildfire Geospatial Intelligence Unit, Wildfire Operations, Wildfire Management Branch, Forestry Division
stepProc.rpOrgName: Agriculture and Forestry, Government of Alberta

prcStep.stepDesc: Added the value of "Vega Fire" to the ALIAS field where FIRENUMBER = "DS2-020-1968".
prcStep.stepRat: Missing a major historical fire name.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: Alberta Land and Forest Service GIS Standards (2000)

edom.edomvds: For 2001 - 2009: The fire number is defined as follows: Aaa-BBB-YYYY where A is the Fire Management District Identifier (e.g. L) The Fire Management District Identifier and Fire Type convention are defined in the Numbering of Fires and Projects (Policy No: FPD6.9), Forest Protection Division. aa is the Fire Type (e.g. WF) BBB is the fire sequence number in that Geoadministrative Area (e.g. 014) YYYY is the year the fire occurred (e.g. 1973)
edom.edomvd: Alberta Land and Forest Service GIS Standards (2000)
